title: Bayernâ€™s ultimate insult after Sanchez caught out
text:
UCL Extra Time: Bayern Munich trolls Arsenal, Alexis Sanchez smirks on the bench, Ramosâ€™s record FOX SPORTS March 8, 2017 2:15pm 
BAYERN Munich rub in Arsenalâ€™s loss, Alexis Sanchez caught laughing on the bench and Sergio Ramosâ€™s unbelievable record. 
Itâ€™s Champions League Extra Time! 
BEST REACTION TO WIN 
Bayern Munich couldnâ€™t help but rub in their humiliation of Arsenal. After putting 10 goals past the Gunners in two Champions League ties, or 15 in three if you include their meeting last season, itâ€™s safe to say the Bavarian giants saw the funny side of things. 
Props to their social media team for having the gall to post the ultimate insult. What time is it? Yep, it's ten to! ðŸ”¥ #UCL #ARSFCB pic.twitter.com/T2lDkvivkS â€” FC Bayern English (@FCBayernEN) March 7, 2017 
â€¦ LEAST BEAST REATION TO LOSS 
Meanwhile, Alexis Sanchezâ€™s reaction to the loss wasnâ€™t quite as good. Maybe he too saw the funny side of things after Arturo Vidal slotted Bayernâ€™s fifth of the night. 
Once that goal went in, the camera panned to Sanchez on the bench, who was seen covering his mouth trying to conceal laughter. 
WATCH SANCHEZâ€™S REACTION IN THE VIDEO AT THE TOP OF THE PAGE 
Safe to say itâ€™s another sign that Sanchez could be on his way out of the club in the off-season. 
BAYERN AND GUNNERS FANS PROTEST 
Both sets of fans staged protests for VERY different reasons in Arsenalâ€™s thumping at the hands of Bayern Munich. 
Before the game, a set of Gunners fans staged a protest march wanting Arsene Wenger out of their club and the contract offer taken off the table. Fans chant 'Wenger Out' 0:30 
UCL: These were the chants outside the Emirates before Arsenals humiliating 5-1 defeat to Bayern Munich We can only imagine what theyd be singing now. March 8th 2017 /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Football/ Fans chant 'Wenger Out' 
Then, with the game less than a minute old, Bayern fans threw a stream of toilet rolls onto the field to protest the price of tickets to the Champions League clash. Bayern fans stage protest 0:52 
UCL: Bayern Munich fans made their presence felt in the opening minute at the Emirates, staging a protest by hurling roll after roll of toilet paper onto the pitch. March 8th 2017
